comment.author: 48236157@N02
comment._content: Great photo. Do we know where this photo was taking?

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/48236157@N02] Very hard to read, but the back of the photo says "US Air Force eclipse expedition to Africa 1952...at North Barracks, Khartoum Anglo-Egyptian Sudan, Africa"
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: Our friend Google suggests there was a big international scientific presence at Khartoum for a total eclipse of the Sun, 25 February 1952. The USAF put up a B-29 over the Red Sea area with observers, cameras and instruments. Presumably the gentlemen in shorts here are non-American?
